content.description: The <math alttext="C F T R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>CFTR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> protein is made up of <math alttext="1,480" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>1,480</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> amino acids linked together in a chain. Some humans produce a version of the <math alttext="C F T R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>CFTR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> protein in which phenylalanine (an amino acid) has been deleted from position 508 of the amino acid chain.
content.question: Which of the following best predicts how the amino acid deletion will affect the structure of the <math alttext="C F T R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>CFTR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> protein?

choices.label: It will have no observable effect on the structure of the <math alttext="C F T R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>CFTR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> protein.

It will affect the primary structure of the <math alttext="C F T R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>CFTR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> protein, but the other levels of protein structure will not be affected.

It will affect the secondary and tertiary structures of the <math alttext="C F T R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>CFTR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> protein, but the primary structure will not be affected.

It will affect the primary, secondary, and tertiary structures of the <math alttext="C F T R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>CFTR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> protein.

content.answer: It will affect the primary, secondary, and tertiary structures of the <math alttext="C F T R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>CFTR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> protein.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
